titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Napoleon B. Thurmond, Indictment
CWG4441

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Crittenden Circuit Court
Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Napoleon B Thurmond

The Grand Jury of Crittenden County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Napoleon B Thurmond of the crime of Murder Committed as follows to wit The said Napoleon B Thurmond on the 9th day of November 1863 in the County aforesaid did feloniously and with Malice aforethought kill and murder Malinda a female Slave the property of Philip Thurmond by shooting her with a pistol against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Jno T Bunch
atty protem Comth

Information by
Philip Thurmond
Polly N Thurmond
James S Thurmond not of the Grand Jury
Summons Samuel & Mrs Hannah Carrick who was not before the Jury for the Comth = a True bill James W Wilson foreman

No Bail allowed on this indictment
W P Fowler Judge
Filed in open Court Novr 11th 1863

J H Walker Clk
A Copy Attest J H Walker C C C C
